intro: Erigeron cabulicus, commonly known as Afghan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white to pale blue, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Erigeron cabulicus is often found in elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,500 meters, thriving in well-drained soils.
